register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Device Configuration Register

bitfield.description: Active Internal Diagnostic Features:
Number of Datatypes DT_NUMBER=8
Number of Virtual Channels VC_NUMBER=16
Internal Datapath width
Number of Stream interfaces
DPHY present
Max Number of Lanes

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Status Register

bitfield.description: Ultra Low Power Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that ultra low power mode is active.
High Speed Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that high speed mode is active.
Frame Transmission Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that frame transmission is active.
Unused bits
Configuration Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that the CSI2TX module is in the configuration mode.
Soft Reset Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that soft reset is active.
Bypass Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that bypass mode is active.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Interrupt Register. Write '1' to clear

bitfield.description: Pixel IF 3 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the DPhy is not ready.
Pixel IF 3 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the DPhy is not ready.
Pixel IF 2 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the DPhy is not ready.
Pixel IF 1 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the DPhy is not ready.
Pixel IF 0 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Interrupt Mask Set Register

bitfield.description: Pixel IF 3 Line Number Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_number_error_irq bit.
Pixel IF 3 Byte Count Mismatch Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the byte_count_mismatch_irq bit.
Pixel IF 3 FIFO Overflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the data_flow_err_irq bit.
Pixel IF 3 FIFO Underflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the fifo_underflow_irq bit.
Pixel IF 3 Line End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_en_irq bit.
Pixel IF 3 Line Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 3 Frame End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_end_irq bit.
Pixel IF 3 Frame Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 Line Number Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_number_error_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 Byte Count Mismatch Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the byte_count_mismatch_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 FIFO Overflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the data_flow_err_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 FIFO Underflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the fifo_underflow_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 Line End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_en_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 Line Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 Frame End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_end_irq bit.
Pixel IF 2 Frame Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Line Number Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_number_error_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Byte Count Mismatch Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the byte_count_mismatch_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 FIFO Overflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the data_flow_err_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 FIFO Underflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the fifo_underflow_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Line End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_en_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Line Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Frame End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_end_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Frame Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Line Number Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_number_error_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Byte Count Mismatch Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the byte_count_mismatch_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 FIFO Overflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the data_flow_err_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 FIFO Underflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the fifo_underflow_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Line End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_en_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Line Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Frame End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_end_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Frame Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_start_irq bit.

register.description: DPHY Transmitter Interrupt Status. Level sensitive interrupt bits driven by DPHY signal pins. Write 1 to clear

bitfield.description: DPHY Transmitter Lane 3 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Lane 2 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Lane 1 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Lane 0 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Lane 3 ERR_ESC_IRQ

DPHY Transmitter Lane 0 ERR_SYNC_ESC_IRQ

register.description: DPHY Transmitter Interrupt Mask. Writing '1' to any bit enables interrupt generation when signal is set and interrupts are enabled.

bitfield.description: DPHY Transmitter Mask Lane 3 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Mask Lane 2 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Mask Lane 1 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Mask Lane 0 ERR_CONTROL_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Mask Lane 3 ERR_ESC_IRQ
DPHY Transmitter Mask Lane 2 ERR_ESC_IRQ

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Configuration Register

bitfield.description: Interrupt Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupts.
Configuration Request - Writing 1 to this bit enables configuration mode.
Soft Reset Request - Writing 1 to this bit enables soft reset.
Bypass Mode - Enable Writing 1 to this bit enables bypass mode.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter DPHY Wait Time configuration Register

bitfield.description: Tx clock exit time - Number of tx_byte_clk cycles corresponding to the HS clock exit time.
Wait Burst Time - Number of tx_byte_clk cycles corresponding to the inter HS burst gap.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter DPHY Lane Enable configuration Register

bitfield.description: DPHY Clock Lane Reset - Active low reset for DPHY clock lane.
DPHY Line 0 Reset - Active low reset for DPHY data lane 3.
DPHY Line 0 Reset - Active low reset for DPHY data lane 2.
DPHY Line 0 Reset - Active low reset for DPHY data lane 1.
DPHY Line 0 Reset - Active low reset for DPHY data lane 0.
DPHY Calibration Enable.
DPHY Clock Mode.
DPHY Mode.
DPHY Clock Lane - Active high enable for DPHY clock lane.
DPHY Lane 3 Enable - Active high enable for DPHY data lane 0.
DPHY Lane 2 Enable - Active high enable for DPHY data lane 0.
DPHY Lane 1 Enable - Active high enable for DPHY data lane 0.
DPHY Lane 0 Enable - Active high enable for DPHY data lane 0.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter DPHY Clock Lane wakeup time configuration Register

bitfield.description: DPHY clock lane wakeup time in esc_clk cycles.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter DPHY Data Lane wakeup time configuration Register

bitfield.description: DPHY data lane wakeup time in in esc_clk cycles.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Virtual Channel 0 Configuration Register

bitfield.description: Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 0.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 0.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Data Type 0 Configuration Register with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0

bitfield.description: Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 0.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 0.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Data Type 0 Format Register

bitfield.description: Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Data Type 1 Configuration Register with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1

bitfield.description: Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1.

Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 1.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 1.

bitfield.description: Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1.

register.description: CSI2 Stream 0 Configuration Register

bitfield.description: Fill Level - Minimum number of packed 32 words loaded into the stream fifo before Tx will start for Stream if 0.

bitfield.description: Stream Slave Mode suppresses frame start/end packets in stream 1.

bitfield.description: Stream Slave Mode suppresses frame start/end packets in stream 3.
Fill Level - Minimum number of packed 32 words loaded into the stream fifo before Tx will start for Stream if 3.

register.description: DPHY Transmitter Configuration.

bitfield.description: DPHY Transmitter Power Down Common Module
DPHY Transmitter Power Down TX Clock
DPHY Transmitter Power Down TX Data Lanes
DPHY Transmitter Swap DP_DN on Clock Lane
DPHY Transmitter Swap DP_DN on TX Data Lanes
DPHY Transmitter FORCE_STOP_MODE TX Data Lanes

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Test Register.

bitfield.description: CSI2 Transmitter Test Generic Status signals.
CSI2 Transmitter Test Generic Control signals.

register.description: ASF Interrupt Status Register. This register indicates the source of ASF interrupts. The corresponding bit in the mask register must be clear for a bit to be set. If any bit is set in this register the asf_int_fatal or asf_int_nonfatal signal will be asserted. Writing to either raw or masked registers, clear both registers. For test purposes, trigger signal interrupt event by writing to the ASF interrupt test register.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Integrity error interrupt
Protocol error interrupt
Transaction timeouts error interrupt
Configuration and
Data and address paths parity error interrupt
SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt
SRAM correctable error interrupt

register.description: ASF Interrupt Raw Status Register. A bit set in this raw register indicates a source of ASF fault in the corresponding feature. Writing to either raw or masked registers, clear both registers. For test purposes, trigger signal interrupt event by writing to the ASF interrupt test register.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Integrity error interrupt
Protocol error interrupt
Transaction timeouts error interrupt
Configuration and
Data and address paths parity error interrupt
SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt
SRAM correctable error interrupt

register.description: The ASF interrupt mask register indicating which interrupt bits in the ASF interrupt register are masked. All bits are set at reset. Clear the individual bit to enable the corresponding interrupt.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Mask bit for integrity error interrupt
Mask bit for protocol error interrupt.
Mask bit for transaction timeouts error interrupt.
Mask bit for configuration and
Mask bit for data and address paths parity error interrupt.
Mask bit for SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt.
Mask bit for SRAM correctable error interrupt.

register.description: The ASF interrupt test register emulate hardware even. Write one to individual bit to trigger single event in (masked and raw) registers according to mask and will generate interrupt accordingly.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Test bit for integrity error interrupt
Test bit for protocol error interrupt.
Test bit for transaction timeouts error interrupt.
Test bit for configuration and
Test bit for data and address paths parity error interrupt.
Test bit for SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt.
Test bit for SRAM correctable error interrupt.

register.description: The fatal or non-fatal interrupt register selects whether a fatal (asf_int_fatal) or non-fatal (asf_int_nonfatal) interrupt is triggered. If the bit of the event will be set to one then fatal interrupt (asf_int_fatal) will be triggered. Otherwise the non-fatal interrupt (asf_int_nonfatal) will be triggered.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Enable integrity error interrupt as fatal
Enable protocol error interrupt as fatal.
Enable transaction timeouts error interrupt as fatal.
Enable configuration and
Enable data and address paths parity error interrupt as fatal.
Enable SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt as fatal.
Enable SRAM correctable error interrupt as fatal.

register.description: Status register for SRAM correctable fault. These fields are updated whenever asf_sram_corr_fault input is active.

bitfield.description: Last SRAM instance that generated fault.
Last SRAM address that generated fault.

register.description: Status register for SRAM uncorrectable fault. These fields are updated whenever asf_sram_uncorr_fault input is active.

bitfield.description: Last SRAM instance that generated fault.
Last SRAM address that generated fault.

register.description: Statistics register for SRAM faults. Note that this register clears when software writes to any field.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Count of number of correctable errors if implemented.

register.description: Control register to configure the ASF transaction timeout monitors.

bitfield.description: Enable transaction timeout monitoring.
Timer value to use for transaction timeout monitor.

register.description: Control register to mask out ASF transaction timeout faults from triggering interrupts. On reset, all bits are set to mask out all sources. Clear the corresponding bit to enable the interrupt source. The width of this field is parameterisable and the bit definitions are implementation specific.

bitfield.description: Mask register for each ASF transaction timeout fault source.
Mask register for each ASF transaction timeout fault source.
Mask register for each ASF transaction timeout fault source.
Mask register for each ASF transaction timeout fault source.
Mask register for each ASF transaction timeout fault source.

register.description: Status register for transaction timeouts fault. If a fault occurs the revelant bit will be set to 1. Each bit can be cleared by software writing 1 to each bit.

bitfield.description: Status bits for transaction timeouts faults.
Status bits for transaction timeouts faults.
Status bits for transaction timeouts faults.
Status bits for transaction timeouts faults.
Status bits for transaction timeouts faults.

register.description: Control register to mask out ASF Protocol faults from triggering interrupts. On reset, all bits are set to mask out all sources. Clear the corresponding bit to enable the interrupt source. The width of this field is parameterisable and the bit definitions are implementation specific.

bitfield.description: Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.

Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.
Mask register for each ASF protocol fault source.

register.description: Status register for protocol faults. If a fault occurs the revelant bit will be set to 1. Each bit can be cleared by software writing 1 to each bit

register.description: CSI2 Transmitter Product ID and Version Register. This register is hard-coded in order to allow software to identify the product and its release version. The product ID will be fixed for all versions, while the version will be updated as new releases for the same product are made.

bitfield.description: CSI2 Transmitter Product Identification Number.
CSI2 Transmitter Product Version Number.
